citations.narrative:
A child was observed standing on the top board of the approximately 4’ high primary enclosure fence that overlooks the
non-flighted bald eagle’s enclosure. No measures were in place to prevent the child from falling into the enclosure or
throwing things at the animal. There was no adequate barrier preventing contact between the bald eagle and the public
and no attendant was present. Per the regulations, during public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is
minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animals and the
general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals and the public. Correct by 31Oct2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
